snippet: Officer Isaias Alicea was arraigned on 10 felony counts after he said he witnessed two men involved in a drug sale, but a surveillance video disputed that account.
abstract: New York City Police Officer Isaias Alicea pleads not guilty and is released without bail after being indicted for allegedly falsifying documents in arrest of drug suspect; claims he witnessed two men make drug sale in housing project lobby, but security video shows that the two men never came in contact with each other; felony charge carries a maximum sentence of four years in prison.

byline.contributor: Joseph Goldstein and Wendy Ruderman contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Officer Isaias Alicea was arraigned on 10 felony counts after he said he witnessed two men involved in a drug sale, but a surveillance video disputed that account.

headline.seo: Harlem Officer Accused of False Arrest Faces Felony Charges
headline.main: Felony Charges for Officer Accused of False Arrest
headline.print_headline: Felony Charges for Officer Accused of False Arrest
